line_1: Passion and grief his noble breast pervade,
line_2: With purer thoughts again he seeks the maid,

line_1: And gold gilding-tincture the meadows pervade;
line_2: And weary scorch'd haymakers long for the shade.

line_1: May thy pitying spirit here pervade,
line_2: The cell of bondage fewer woes invade,

line_1: By Sounds so gently we pervade,
line_2: So unperceiv'd the Trace is made,

line_1: By Sounds so gently we pervade,
line_2: And Picture to the Mind convey'd.

line_1: Wide wastes of sand the gelid gales pervade,
line_2: And ocean cools beneath the moving shade.

line_1: YOU with nice ear, in tiptoe trains, pervade
line_2: Dim walks of morn or evening's silent shade;
Or, Fancy, who the mystic shade,

line_1: Not for the bounding Dance; — not to pervade,
line_2: Yet, not to deck pale hours with vain parade

line_1: " And pleasure thus your hearts pervade! "

line_2: " Or seek you riches in the world of trade? "

line_1: For hard's the task the daubing to pervade
line_2: Folly and fraud on Truth's fair form have laid;

line_1: Ray of th' eternal beam! who canst pervade
line_2: The distant past, and future's gloomy shade;
